reviewText: What a waste of money. It's not a game. Developer is talking about it being a VR game. Why they display it in simulator, I don't know. It's not doing anything and the ship doesn't even sail.
voteText: 41 of 61 people (67%) found this review helpful 5 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Controls are fiddly, using sort-of Tank controls that don't really make sense in VR. I only played very briefly and felt motion-sick (I work with VR headsets every day, it takes a lot to make me feel queezy in VR). Some interactive objects also unexpectedly moved the camera, causing sudden disconnect that added to my nausea.
Collision is a little all over the place, can often just walk through stuff.
General framework/layout and experience is missing, no menus or any sort of introduction into what's going on.

Graphics are lovely however, but they don't make up for the lack of content. With the above fixed, I still can't see this for more than £1.99 on Steam.
voteText: 14 of 21 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Just tried this on CV1. It's not a game as such, but as an exploration/sitting around admiring the view experience, it's fantastic. The visuals look great and the minigames are entertaining (particularly flying as the bird). If you're looking for somewhere to just hang out in VR, this is perfect.

reviewText: Amazing graphics for current VR hardware.  Enjoyed the slow pace; just watching the ship rock and waves roll by.  Can't wait for Vive support!
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I really enjoy Aerie and how it has improved over the past few months, so I figured I'd pick this up as well.   I was nervous about getting seasick, but fortunately that never became a problem.\n\nThe graphics are some of the best I've seen in VR.  Hopefully the devs will add more content as they did to Aerie, because I'd like to spend more time here.  It's well worth the price if you love pirate ships.

reviewText:
I really enjoyed this VR experience! Amazing surprises and special effects!
It will be a while until hardware is ready to move the ship so, I understand why it is stationary.
Nevertheless, its very cool VR experience to showcase friends and get everyone excited about VR!
A must have !

reviewText: This is one of the best VR experiences so far.  The graphics are amazing.  Controls were simple.  I never felt sick at all.  Steering the seagull around the island with your head is a blast!

reviewText: Cool demo, but needs work. The model is good but movement feels strange and there are frequent glitches with lighting and collisions. No options menu of any kind. Has potential to be a cool exploration experiance. Just needs polish.
voteText: 6 of 12 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText: This is a very neat concept that still needs some work. The authentic Galleon is quite cool to explore and there are a ton of neat little surprise actions hidden throughout the game (things to open, things to activate, things to briefly enter the POV of). The graphics are great, but the movement is a bit odd and gave me pretty strong nausea. I'm looking forward to trying this in room scale with the vive, but I really think the movement will need something like Cloudhead's Blink locomotion or cloudstep.\n\nI have to recommend against the game at the $9.99 pricepoint in its current state. Given an updated movement system and some bugfixes for some minor graphical glitches, or a drop in pice to 2-3 dollars, I'd change this to a yes.
voteText: 5 of 10 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText: This was a solid experience, but could use some improvements. But as others have said, don't go into it expecting gameplay". You basically can roam around a couple environments
date:
and interact with a few objects (i.e. fire cannons).

Positives:

-Great Graphics/Visuals

-Several Interesting and unexpected interactions

-Boobies

Negatives:

-Needs further optimization. i5 4690K and R9 390 were not enough to be completely judder free in all areas. Island was especially bad.

-$10 seems steep for the lack of replay value

-Controls could be improved
recommended: and maybe add a pause menu with controls listed."

reviewText: Very impressed!  While some may feel (correctly), that this is not a game, these VR experiences" still provide much opportunity to entertain as the developer VROOM has crammed in many little details that elevate this to near simulation status
date: while also providing the user with many items to interact with.\n\nPro's:  SCALE!!   From the very start
recommended: you can appreciate the incredible sense of scale this experience provides.  You start off in the middle of a Galleon
hoursPlayed: with the first thing that catches your eyes are the high mast
voteText: then the size of the ship
votesHelpful: etc.  Not that I've ever been on one but..
votesTotal: it just feels right and the 3D conveyed here once again shows why VR is a winner to anyone who tries it!\n\nGraphics:  Everything is rendered well
votesFunny: with above average texture work.  The water though helps elevate the experience to another level as it's quite beautiful and flat out hypnotising.   I caught myself staring a few times
commentsCount: just looking out into the distance.\n\nInteraction:  There are many items (the description lists 74).  I won't list them here (the entire point of VR experiences is to... experience these for yourselves) but there's a sufficient amount that it should lead me to keep searching to find them all.  I will say some of the secrets show a decent amount of imagination! LOL  Word of warning... stay off the sauce; if not
column16: you'll regret it.. especially in VR!!  :)\n\nIssues:  The only glitch I've seen on the current version is once I was in the water
column18: there seemed to be glitches on the edge of my peripheral vision.  Nothing horribly bad nor that distracting but should be mentioned just the same.\n\nRecommendation:  For me
column21: there is always room for improvement.  Same as others
column22: I would love to be able to sail and/or attack other ships but understand the engine doesn't currently allow this level of interaction while keeping this required frame rate.  Fair enough
column23:
but maybe more could be added via:

- something to keep track of the interactive objects you've discovered (ie; achievements). This would greatly expand on the user's need to keep exploring (we love to catch ‘em all!)
- more items to interact with
column24:
I guess we can never have enough ;)
- Adjusting the canon's so that we can turn them into a target mini-game (or sinking ships in the distance along the lines of classic arcade games of old... including keeping track of high-scores)

Recap and rating:  although not a game per say
column25: this experience still hits home and is a success. There's lots to do
column26: the quality is evident and although there is room for improvement
column27: IMHO from a POV of experience
column28:
it's a worthwhile investment.  I rate this experience a 4 out of 5 stars.

looking forward to seeing what's next from VRoom!
